it.polimi.group03.domain

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group03.domain.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will define a player in the game and his beads added (using addBead(Bead) to the game. The player will remain in the game till the end unless all it's beads have fallen, in that case, the status will be set it as inactive.
    Since:
    08/11/2015.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    cecibloom, megireci, tatibloom
    See Also:
    Bead

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      Indicates whether if a player is present in the game or not.
      private java.util.List<Bead> beads
      Beads that the player has placed on the board (always 5 beads).
      private java.lang.String color
      Color of the players' beads.
      private int id
      ID of the player, from 0 up to 3.
      private java.lang.String nickname
      Nickname of the player, used for statistics.

      Player(int id, java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String color)

    • Method Detail

      • activeBeads

        public java.util.List<Bead> activeBeads()
        This method will retrieve a list with all the active beads for the player.
        Returns:
        List off all active beads for the current player.
        empty In there is no active beads for the player.

      • addBead

        public void addBead(Bead bead)
        This method will add a new bead to the board for the current player, if there is no bead yet, it will initialize the list. The rules to add the bead are in GameValidator.
        Parameters:
        bead - Bead to be placed on the board.
